item.title: 동명사
item.before_start:
동명사란 무엇인가? 라는 질문을 던지면 대부분의 학생들은 동사이면서 명사 역할을 하는 것이라 대답한다. 어느 정도 맞는 대답처럼 보이지만 사실은 전혀 틀린 답을 말하고 있는 것이다. 간단히 말하면, 동명사는 명사이다. 동명사가 여러가지 특성을 갖고 있지만 그 핵심 개념은 명사이다. 이 핵심 개념으로부터 모든 것의 출발점이 이루어진다.
이러한 정확한 개념이 영어에 관한 모든 문제점을 해결해준다.
나아가서 문장에서는 주어, 목적어, 보어, 전치사의 목적어로 쓰일 수 있다는 것을 자연스럽게 이해해야한다.. 또한 더더욱이 중요한 것은 동명사가 drinking, swimming 등과 같이 단순히 한 두 단어로 문장에서 쓰이는 것이 아니라, drinking water in the morning. swimming in the river 와 같이 긴 형태로 쓰인다는 것이다. 이를 철저히 이해해야만 영어에 대한 두려움이 사라질 것이다.
핵심 개념을 이해하였으니 문장에서 어떤식으로 쓰이는지, 해석하는 방법, 그리고 어떤식으로 문장이 길어지는 지를 이해하면 될 것이다.

basic_concept.ex: 예 : drinking, reading, speaking, walking, swimming.

in_sentence.how_to: 문장에서 : 주어, 목적어, 보어, 전치사의 목적어
in_sentence.ex_s: Drinking is eating.
She likes swimming.
My hobby is collecting stamps.
She is sure of passing the examination.

basic_concept.reason_getting_longer:
문장이 길어지는 이유.
Drinking water in the morning is good for the health.→
My hobby is being in the room in winter.→
They like swimming in the river.→
She is ashamed of being late.→
He is proud of being brave.→

contents.explanation:
1.동명사는 명사이다. 동사이면서 명사 역할을 하는 것이라는 애매한 생각을 과감히 버려라. 동명사는 그저 하나의 명사이다. 여기서 부터 모든 문제가 풀리기 시작한다.
2.동명사의 형태는 동사원형 + ing 이다.
3.drinking, reading 등이 그 예이다.
4.해석은 --하는 것, 또는 --하기이다. 그러므로 drinking는 마시는 것, reading은 읽는 것등으로 해석한다.
5.문장에서는 주어, 목적어, 보어, 전치사의 목적어로 쓰인다.
6.마시는 것은 먹는 것이다. 그녀는 수영하는 것을 좋아한다. 나의 취미는 우표를 모으는 것이다. 그녀는 시험에 합격할 것을 확신한다.
문장이 길어지는 이유
간단히, "마시는 것"을 영어로 표현하자면 어떻게 하면 되는가? 그저 drinking 이라 표혀하면 될 것이다. 그러나 "아침에 물을 마시는 것"을 영어로 표현하자면 어떻게 해야 하는가? 여기서부터 영어가 어떤식으로 길어지는 지를 이해해야 한다. 아침에 물을 마시는 것을 직접 영작하기 전에 "그는 아침에 물을 마신다"을 영어로 표현하면, He drinks water in the morning 이다. 이를 아침에 물을 마시는 것을 에 적용한다면 drinking water in the morning 가 되는 것이다. 다시 말해

item.title: 현재 분사
item.before_start:
본인은 항상 영어를 가르칠때 용어에 대한 개념을 묻는다. 잘못된 생각을 고치고 정확한 개념을 주지시켜주기 위해서이다. 현재분사가 무엇이냐고 물어 보면 대부분의 학생을 정확한 대답을 못한다. 그저 어렴풋이 그저 대충 생각하고 넘어가는 것이다. 이는 영어의 늪에 빠지고야 말겠다는 무언의 의사표현이나 마찬가지이다. 영어를 공부하고자 하면 아니 영어를 정복하고자 하면 용어에 대한 정확한 개념을 파악해야 한다. 그렇지 않고는 절대 영어를 이해할 수 없다. 영어를 공부할 수록 더더욱 영어의 암흑에 갇히고야 마는 것이다.
그렇다면 현재분사는 무엇일까? 현재분사는 한마디로 정리할 수 있다. 그것은 바로 형용사이다. 현재분사의 여러가지 특성이 있지만 현재분사의 본질은 형용사이다. 이 개념을 정확하게 이해할 때 현재분사에 관한 모든 문제는 스르르 풀리게 되는 것이다. 현재분사가 형용사이니 그 다음에는 무엇을 생각해야 할까? 그렇다 바로 문장에서 어떻게 쓰이는가를 생각해야한다. 형용사는 문장에서 한정적 용법과 서술적 용법으로 쓰인다고 했다. 이러한 법칙에 조금도 어긋나지 않는다. 현재분사는 바로 문장에서 한정적 용법, 서술적 용법 딱 두가지로 쓰이는 것이다. 나아가서 문장이 어떤식으로 길어지는 가를 파악해야한다. 문장이 길어지는 데는 또한 정확한 규칙에 의해서 길어지기 때문이다. 화자의 기분에 따라 무질서하게 길어지는 것이 아니라 정확한 문장의 규칙에 의거하여 문장이 길어지는 것이다.

basic_concept.ex: 예: drinking, reading, speaking, walking, swimming.

in_sentence.ex_s: The boy reading a book in the room is my friend.
They kept standing in the street for an hour.
I heard him singing a song in English.

basic_concept.reason_getting_longer:
문장이 길어지는 이유.
The man reading the book is my uncle.
The house standing on the mountain is very old.
The children watching T.V. in the room are my nephews.
The man sings writing a letter.
Tom and Bill walk talking about the movie.
They sing looking at the sky.

contents.explanation:
1.현재분사는 형용사이다.
2.형태는 동명사와 마찬가지로 동사원형 + ing 이다.
3.drinking, reading, speaking 등이 그 예이다.
4.해석하는 방법은 --하는 이다.
5.문장에서는 한정적 용법과 서술적 용법 두가지로 쓰일 수 있다.
6.첫번 째 문장은 한정적 용법의 예문이다.
7.두 번 째 문장은 서술적 용법의 예문이다.
8.세번 째 문장은 서술적 용법의 예문이다.
9.
10.문장이 길어지는 이유

level_3.p: The enlargement consists in the addition of a chapter on the “Contrasted Properties of Matter and the Ether,” a chapter containing something which the author believes to be of philosophical importance in these days when electricity is so generally described as a phenomenon of the ether.

‘And now we might add something concerning a most subtle spirit which pervades and lies hid in all gross bodies, by the force and action of which spirit the particles of bodies attract each other at near distances, and cohere if contiguous, and electric bodies operate at greater distances, as well repelling as attracting neighbouring corpuscles, and light is emitted, reflected, inflected, and heats bodies, and all sensation is excited, and members of animal bodies move at the command of the will.’—Newton, Principia.

*To us, who have grown up familiar with the principles and conceptions underlying them, all varieties of mechanical phenomena seem so obvious, that it is difficult for us to understand how any one could be obtuse to them; but the records of Newton's time, and immediately after this, show that they were not so easy of apprehension.

비교 구별
비교 구별 * 동명사와 현재분사의 구분. (1) Do you like swimming? (동명사) (2) The boy running there is my brother.(현재분사) (3) A barking dog never bites.(현재분사) (4) He praised me for doing a good job.(동명사) (5) He is like a walking dictionary.(현재분사) (6) My grandfather has a good walking-stick.(동명사) (7) The gentleman sitting on the chair is the principal of our school.(현재분사) (8) The brook running here is very clear(.현재분사) -- a sleeping child(현재분사-상태) -- a sleeping car ( =a sleeping-car) (동명사-용도) -- a walking dictionary (현재분사-상태) -- a walking stick.(=a walking-stick) (동명사-용도) -- a smoking brand. (현재분사-상태) -- a smoking room (=a smoking-room) (동명사-용도)

item.title: 과거 분사
item.before_start:
과거 분사란 무엇인가? 과거분사는 학생들이 가장 어려워 하는 개념중이 하나이다. 왜 어려울까? 그 이유는 3가지 정도로 압축할 수 있다. 첫째, 역시 용어에 대한 정확한 개념이 부족해서 이다. 둘때, 과거분사는 미국인들의 사고방식이 그대로 녹아있는 표현 방식이다. 셋째, 영어의 문장이 과거분사와 관련하여 어떤식으로 길어지는 지를 이해하지 못하기 때문이다.
우선 과거분사의 핵심적 개념을 정의해보자. 용어는 과거분사이지만 핵심적 개념은 무엇일까? 과거분사는 간단히 말하면 형용사이다. 현재분사가 형용사이듯이 과거분사 역시 형용사이다. 물론 현재 분사와 과거 분사는 개별적 특성이 다르지만 공통적 핵심 개념은 형용사이다. 과거분사가 형용사라는 정확한 개념을 가지고 학업을 출발할때 또한 과거분사에 관한 모든 문제는 풀릴 것이다.

in_sentence.how_to: 문장에서: 한정적 용법, 서술 적 용법
in_sentence.ex_s: The food made by him is deligious.
The food is made by him.

basic_concept.reason_getting_longer:
문장이 길어지는 이유
The books written by him are read wide.
Here is a letter written in English.
They had their hair cut.
I will take my picture taken.
Park seri is known to us all.
The students satisfied with the result of the exam made for home.

contents.explanation:
1.과거 분사는 형용사이다.
2.형태는 동사원형 + ed 이다.
3.drinking, reading, speaking 등이 그 예이다.
4.해석하는 방법은 --하여진 이다.
5.문장에서는 한정적 용법과 서술적 용법 두가지로 쓰일 수 있다.
6.첫번 째 문장은 한정적 용법의 예문이다.
7.두 번 째 문장은 서술적 용법의 예문이다.
8.세번 째 문장은 서술적 용법의 예문이다.
9.
10.문장이 길어지는 이유

level_1.p: The energy called heat energy was proved to be a vibratory motion of molecules,
Sun, planets, satellites, comets and meteors are all controlled by gravitation.
So long as the atoms of matter were regarded as hard round particles, they were assumed to be inert and only active when acted upon by what were called forces,

level_2.p: A bullet shot into the air has its velocity continuously reduced by the air, to which its energy is imparted by making it move out of its way.
Such rings formed in air by a locomotive may rise wriggling in the air to the height of several hundred feet, but they are soon dissolved and disappear.
It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a large fortune must be in want of a wife.
No fundamental principles were known until the law of gravitation was discovered.
The various kinds of matter we are acquainted with are commonly called the elements.

level_3.p: In spite of what is thought to be reasonable, it really requires something more than complete demonstration to convince most of us of the truth of an idea, should the truth happen to be of a kind not familiar, or should it chance to be opposed to our more or less well-defined notions of what it is or ought to be.
Yet few persons have taken the necessary pains to think out clearly what mechanical changes take place when one form of energy is transformed into another.

practice.p: 다음을 영작하라. ①그에 의해서 쓰여진 책들은 널리 읽혀지고 있다. →The books written by him are read wide. ②여기 영문으로 쓰여진 편지가 한 장 있다. →Here is a letter written in English. ③그들은 머리를 깎았다. →They had their hair cut. ④나는 내 사진을 찍을 것이다. →I will have my picture taken. ⑤박세리는 우리 모두에게 알려져 있다. →Park seri is known to us all. ⑥시험의 결과에 만족한 학생들은 집으로 향했다.→The students satisfied with the result ot the exam made for home.
비교 구별 현재분사과 과거분사의 차이 책을 읽는 소년 그 소년에 의해서 읽혀진 책 편지를 쓰는 소녀 그 소녀에 의해서 쓰여진 편지

item.title: To 부정사
item.before_start:
대부분의 영어 문법책들은 준동사를 설명할 때 부정사를 제일 먼저 앞세운다. 그러나 공부하는 순서는 동명사 현재분사 부정사 이런 순서대로 공부해야 한다.
부정사는 무엇인가? To 부정사는 무엇인가? 원형부정사는 무엇인가?
우선 부정사의 말의 뜻을 정확히 짚고 넘어가자. 많은 학생들이 부정사의 의미를 혼동하고 있다. 긍정 부정 할때의 부정의 의미인지 부정문 할때 부정의 의미인지 모르고 있는 것이다. 부정사에서의 부정은 부정문이라고 할때의 그러한 부정이 아니라 정해져 있지 않다는 의미의 부정이다. 그렇다면 무엇이 정해져 있지 않다는 것일까? 바로 품사가 정해져 있지 않다는 의미이다. 동명사는 명사이다. 현재분사는 형용사이다. 과거분사도 형용사이다. 그렇다면 부정사는 무엇이란 말인가? 부정사는 품사가 정해져 있지 않다. 다시 말해서 부정사는 명사로도 쓰일 수 있고 형용사로도 쓰일 수 있으면 부사로도 쓰일 수 있다. 이렇듯 용어는 하나지만 부정사는 여러가지 품사로 쓰일 수 있다. 그러하니, 문장에서는 또한 얼마나 복잡하게 쓰일 것인가? 이러한 이유 때문에 영어를 정확히 배우이 위해서는 동명사를 배우고, 그 다음에 현재분사, 과거 분사를 배우며 그 다음에 부정사를 배워야 하는 것이다. 비록 부정사가 문장에서 복잡하게 쓰이기는 하여도 동명사와 현재분사, 과거분사를 철저히 공부했다면 그다지 어렵지 않게 부정사를 이해할 수 있을 것이다.

basic_concept.ex: 예: to drink, to read, to speak, to walk to swim.

in_sentence.how_to: 문장에서: 주어, 목적어, 보어, 전치사의 목적어
in_sentence.ex_s: To run is to walk.
I want to meet her.
Their plan is to rent a building in Seoul.
They have no choice but to follow the rule.

basic_concept.reason_getting_longer:
문장이 길어지는 이유
①To read the newspaper in the morning is his joy.
②He wants to read the newspaper in the morning.
③His plan is to build a house in the country.
④Jane has no time to eat breakfast.
⑤A friend of mine went to Pusan to see the movie.
⑥To go there by seven is impossible.
⑦He studied hard to be a good doctor.
⑧She had no money to buy the book.
⑨His goal is to be a good scientist in the future..
⑩Mrs. Brown was happy to hear her daughter sing.

contents.explanation: 5. 문장이 길어지는 이유 ①아침에 신문을 읽기 위하여→To read the newspaper in the morning.(3형식 형태의 to 부정사)는 그는 아침에 신문을 읽는다. →He reads the newspaper in the morning.(3형식 형태의 문장)에서 주어 생략 후 to+동사 원형의 형태로 위의 영작이 이루어집니다. ②그녀를 Mary라고 부른다면. →To call her Mary.(5형식 형태의 to 부정사)는 그는 그녀를 Mary라고 부른다. →He calls her Mary.(5형식 형태의 문장)에서 주어 생략 후 to+동사 원형의 형태로 위의 영작이 이루어집니다. ③내일 여기에 오는 것. →To come here tomorrow.(1형식 형태의 to 부정사)는 그는 내일 여기에 온다. →He comes here tomorrow.(1형식 형태의 문장)에서 주어 생략 후 to+동사 원형의 형태로 위의 영작이 이루어집니다. ④학생이라는 것. →To be a student.(2형식 형태의 to 부정사)는 그는 학생이다. →He is a student.(2형식 형태의 문장)에서 주어 생략 후 to+동사 원형의 형태 로 위의 영작이 이루어집니다. ⑤나에게 종이 한 장을 줄. →To give me a piece of paper.(4형식 형태의 to 부정사)는 그는 나에게 종이 한 장을 준다. →He gives me a piece of paper.(4형식 형태의 문장)에서 주어 생략 후 to+동사 원형의 형태로 위의 영작이 이루어집니다.

level_1.p: We think it the more incumbent on us to bear this testimony strongly at first setting out
Not every interviewer in New York knows how to _write_--how to put a sentence together decently.

level_2.p: we shall think it right to dwell principally on those parts of it from which we dissent.
It is impossible not to admire the even-handed justice with which he deals out castigation to right and left on the rival persecutors.
To punish a man because he has committed a crime, or because he is believed, though unjustly, to have committed a crime, is not persecution.
And it was difficult to believe that the masthead and its light, and not the star, were dancing.

practice.p: 다음을 영작하라. ①아침에 신문을 읽는 것은 그의 기쁨이다. → ②그는 아침에 신문을 읽고 싶어한다. → ③그의 계획은 시골에 집을 짓는 것이다. → ④Jane은 아침을 먹을 시간이 없다. → ⑤나의 친구 중 하나가 그 영화를 보기 위하여 부산으로 갔다. → ⑥7시까지 거기에 가는 것은 불가능하다. → ⑦그는 훌륭한 의사가 되기 위하여 열심히 공부했다. → ⑧그녀는 그 책을 살 돈이 없었다. → ⑨그의 목표는 미래에 훌륭한 과학자가 되는 것이다. → ⑩ Brown여사는 그녀의 딸이 노래하는 것을 들으니 기뻤다. →

11. to부정사와 동명사의 차이 1) 동명사와 부정사의 목적. 부정사 목적: want, wish, hope, choose, seek, care, agree, promise, refuse, decide, 등 동명사 목적: stop, mind, enjoy, help, finish, avoid, give up, resist, put off, postpone, go on, keep on, admit, 등 둘 다목적: begin, like start, remember, hate, neglect, continue, remember, forget. 2)해석 연습 ①She enjoys watching T. V. everyday. ②The boss wanted to meet the salesman. ③They hope to visit the house. ④Do you mind my smoking? ⑤I forget to meet her. ⑥I forget meeting her. ⑦He remembers to do homework. - 53 - ⑧He remembers doing homework. ⑨He stopped to read. He stopped reading.

basic_concept.ex: 예: to drink, to read, to speak, to walk, to swim

in_sentence.ex_s: The poor girl has no food to eat.
He is to go there.
Mary wants her mother to come back early.
She seems to be sick.

level_1.p: The first to discover this and to repudiate the prevailing terminology were the physiologists.
There is no need to assume anything more mysterious than mechanical action.
"You must not expect me to talk," I said.

level_2.p: yet few persons have taken the necessary pains to think out clearly what mechanical changes take place when one form of energy is transformed into another.
The picture, though it places the country before us, does not enable us to ascertain with accuracy the dimensions, the distances, and the angles.

level_3.p: Such phenomena lead us to conclude that the kinds of matter elsewhere in the universe are identical with such as we are familiar with, and that elsewhere the variety is as great.

item.title: 명사절 : That
item.before_start:
That 명사절은 가장 기본적인 절의 형태이다. 명사절이란 어떤 의미인가? 거기에는 두가지 의미가 있다 하나는 말 그대로 명사라는 것이다. 그러므로 문장에서는 어떻게 쓰이는가? 문장에서는 주어, 목적어, 보어, 전치사의 목적어로 쓰인다.
또한 절이라는 것이다. 다시말하면 That +주어+ 동사의 형태를 갖는다는 것이다.
그러나 문제는 문장에서 나오는 That 절이 명사절인가 관계대명사 절인가 혹은 부사절인가 하는 것이다. 그것을 구별해내는 능력이야 말로 영어에서 가장 중요한 능력이 되는 것이다.
철저하게 학습하여 다양한 절의 형태를 master 할 수 있는 토대를 마련하기 바란다.

basic_concept.ex: 예: that he is a student, that he knows the secret.

in_sentence.how_to: 문장에서: 주어, 목적어, 보어, 전치사의 목적어
in_sentence.ex_s: That he is a student is true.
I didn't know that he is a student.
The fact is that he is a student.

basic_concept.reason_getting_longer:
문장이 길어지는 이유
① That he is a student is true. ( that 절이 주어로 쓰임 )
② I don't know that he is a student. (that 절이 목적어로 쓰임)
③ The fact is that he is a student. (that 절이 보어로 쓰임)
①That he came from America is false.
②They know that he came from America.
③The important thing is that he came from America.

contents.explanation: 기본개념 He is a student. 라는 문장에서 앞에 that을 붙이면 That he is a student. 가 됩니다. 그가 학생이라는 것으로 해석하고 문장이 아니면서 하나의 명사절이 됩니다. 즉 명사로서 문장에서는 주어 목적어 보어로 쓰입니다. 절: 주어와 동사를 갖추고 있는 형태

level_1.p: I thought it would be too unsafe, too risky
We will not positively affirm that a law of this description must always, and under all circumstances, be unjustifiable.
We believe that we might safely content ourselves with stating the fact,
I perceived that my Coney Island was merely another craft, but a very important and official craft.
I couldn’t help but overhear that your children will be staying in Honesty Brook Dale.

level_2.p: We do not believe that every Englishman who was reconciled to the Catholic Church would, as a necessary consequence, have thought himself justified in deposing or assassinating Elizabeth.
But I have noticed that when the variety of interviewing upon which I have just animadverted becomes the topic, quiet, reasonable Americans are apt to drop into causticity.
I don't think that any American ever set foot in Europe with a more profound and delicious thrill than that which affected me at that instant....
Many people believe that we are making continual progress toward a better world.
The fact is that humans' benefit cannot be used to justify using animals in research any more.

level_3.p: That a nation ought to have a constitution as a rule for the conduct of its government is a simple question to which all men will agree.
Democracy is often defined as rule by the majority. This definition is accurate in that a majority must agree on a decision before action is taken.
The man assured him that the necklace was engraved with mysterious symbols that would protect its wearer from all harm.

level_2.p: I own 200 plantations and over 500 hundred slaves even though I have never visited all of them I know that they are in good shape if these slaves keep escaping so easily then we need to take control however drastic it may be.

practice.p: 다음을 영작하라. ①그가 미국에서 왔다는 것은 거짓이다. → ②그들은 그가 미국에서 왔다는 것을 안다. → ③중요한 것은 그가 미국에서 왔다는 것이다.→

item.title: 간접 의문문절
item.before_start:
간접 의문문 절은 문장에서 실로 많이 나오는 형태이다. 더욱이 미국인의 일상 회화에서는 끊임없이 나오는 문장 형태이다.
해석하는 방법과 문장구조를 철저히 파악하여야 한다.
이번 장에서는 간접의문문 절을 완전히 터득함으로써 영어의 진정한 고수가 되기를 바란다.

basic_concept.form: 접속사(when, where, how, why) + 주어 + 동사
basic_concept.ex: 예: What I should do, How she solves the problem, Why they don't go there.

in_sentence.how_to: 문장에서: 주어, 목적어, 보어, 전치사의 목적어
in_sentence.ex_s: I don't know why they don't go there.
How she solves the problem is not important.
I don't know what I should do.

basic_concept.reason_getting_longer:
문장이 길어지는 이유
I didin't ask when he came.
What did the woman say I bought yesterday.
They didn't know how he did the work.
Do you know if he is a doctor?
I don't know which he chose.
Do you know who he studies with?
What he does isn't important.
What do you think I am doing?
How old do you think I am?

level_1.p: I don’t know how much longer I can keep walking.
They knew precisely what they wanted and how to get it.
It doesn't matter what you do in life,
One classmate finally raised his hand and asked her why that particular number was there.
You should decide how important jobs are and when they must be completed.

level_2.p: What we didn't realize is how great the problem has become.
No group, even a religious one, has the right to decide which laws they will obey and which ones they won't.
Ask a busy person, who gets things done, how he or she can possibly take care of his or her jobs with such a full schedule.
You don't need a powerful intellect to guess what is going to happen.

level_3.p: This book is about why, where and in what manner black people in America must get together.
To understand means to see a thing in its relation to the rest of things we know about, to see how far it resembles and how far it differs from other like things.
But no one is at all clear about when it goes wrong or what is to be done about it.
The courage to believe that we don't know what we think we know is the first stage in discovery.

practice.p: 다음을 영작하라. ①나는 그가 언제 오는지 묻지 않았다. → I didn't ask when he comes. ②그 여자는 내가 어제 무엇을 샀다고 말하던가요? → What did she say I bought yesterday? ③그들은 그가 그 일을 어떻게 했는지 몰랐다. → They didn't know how he did the thing. ④당신은 그가 의사인지 아닌지 아느냐? → Do you know if he is a doctor? ⑤나는 그가 어떤 것을 선택했는지 모른다. → I don't know which he chose. ⑥너는 그가 누구와 함께 공부하는지 아느냐? → Do you know who he studies with? ⑦그가 무엇을 하는지는 중요하지 않다. → What he does is not important. ⑧당신은 내가 무엇을 하고 있다고 생각하십니까? → What do you think I am doing? ⑨당신은 내가 몇 살이라고 생각하십니까? → How old do you think I am?

item.title: 동격명사절
item.before_start: 동격 명사절은 명사절 앞에 하나의 명사가 추가되어 나오는 구문 형태이다. 동격명사절을 형용사절로 착각하는 경우가 간혹 있지만 동격 명사절과 형용사 절을 엄연히 다르다. 동격명사절의 여러가지 형태를 제대로 파악하기 바란다.

basic_concept.ex: 예: The fact that she is from Armerica.

in_sentence.how_to: 문장에서: 주어, 목적어, 보어, 전치사의 목적어
in_sentence.ex_s: The fact that he is a student is true.
I didn't know the fact that he is a student.
This is the fact that he is a student.

basic_concept.reason_getting_longer:
문장이 길어지는 이유
The information that he ran away to the states is already proved.
This is the evidence that he developed the software.
F.B.I have the information that he ran away to Russia.

level_1.p: The fact is that both pleas are worthless alike.

One might infer, from what has already been said about continuity, that the ether could not be constituted of separable particles like masses of matter;

item.title: 강조구문
item.before_start: 강조구문은 하나의 사물이나 현상을 강조하여 표현할 때 쓰는 영어의 도구이다. 이 구문은 That 명사절과 비슷하지만 엄연히 다른 형태여서 많은 학생들이 혼란스러워 하는 경우가 많다. 철처히 학습하여 완전히 나의 것으로 만들기를 바란다.

basic_concept.ex: 예: drinking, reading, speaking, walking, swimming.

in_sentence.how_to: 문장에서: 하나의 사물이나 현상을 강조할 때
in_sentence.ex_s: It is a car that she bought yesterday.
It is she that she bought a car yesterday.
It was yesterday that she bought the car.

basic_concept.reason_getting_longer:
문장이 길어지는 이유
It was at Jongro that he bought the computer.
It was pizza that she ate yesterday.
It was at four in the morning that they finished the work.

level_1.p: It is with some hesitation that we bring ourselves to write this little book.
It is for this reason that there are speed limits on roads.
It is from their dialects that American English developed.
It is the reader, not the author, who determines how long fictional heroes will live.

level_2.p: It was not until December of 1817 that the following president, James Monroe, could move into the rebuilt house.
It is for this reason that philosophy has been described as an unusually persistent attempt to think things through.
It's at these times that professional counseling is recommended to save the marriage.
It is not the absence of gun control law that causes accidental deaths.
It is only then that we begin to study what to do with or about it

level_3.p: It is for this reason that philosophy has been described as an unusually persistent attempt to think things through.
It is those who do most of the deeds which grow happiness that enjoy the most and are the happiest.

practice.p: 다음을 영작하라. ① 그가 그 컴퓨터를 산 것은 종로에서였다. →It was in Jongro that he bought the computer. ② 그녀가 어제 먹은 것은 피자였다. →It was pizza that she ate yesterday. ③ 그들이 그 일을 끝마친 것은 새벽 4시였다. →It was at four in the morning that they finished the work.

item.title: 복합관계대명사절
item.before_start: 관계 대명사 절은 형용사 절이지만 복합관계 대명사 절은 명사 절이다. 문장에서는 주어, 목적어, 보어, 전치사의 목적어로 쓰일 수 있다는 의미이다. 또한 그 구조와 숨겨져 있는 문장의 형성과정을 잘 이해하기 바란다.

basic_concept.ex: 예: Whatever you want, Whoever he loves.

in_sentence.how_to: 문장에서: 주어, 목적어, 보어, 전치사의 목적어
in_sentence.ex_s: I will buy whatever I want to have.
I will meet whoever you want me to.
Whoever comes first wins the game.

basic_concept.reason_getting_longer:
문장이 길어지는 이유
Whoever comes first can get it.
I think whoever sleeps till 10 is lazy.

level_1.p: I will take whatever you prepare.
The underlying principle is simple: we cannot allow people to do whatever they like if those actions are likely to cause serious harm.
I will do whatever it takes.
He refuses to let me eat a snack in peace and usually wants half of whatever I have to eat.

level_2.p: we cannot allow people to do whatever they like if those actions are likely to cause serious harm.
Whatever is worth doing at all is worth doing well.

practice.p: 다음을 영작하라. ① Whatever I want leaves me. (주어,) → 내가 원하는 것은 무엇이든지 나를 떠난다. ② I will give you whatever you want. (목적어) → 나는 너에게 네가 원하는 것은 무엇이든지 주겠다. 2) 영작 연습. ① 처음에 오는 사람은 누구든지 그것을 얻을 수 있다. → Whoever comes first can get it. ② 나는 아침 늦게까지 자는 사람은 누구든지 게으르다고 생각한다. → I think whoever sleeps late in the morning lazy.

item.title: 가주어 진주어, 가목적어 진목적어절
item.before_start: 이형태의 구문도 문장에서 자주 나오는 형태이다. 반드시 익혀 두어야 영어를 제대로 이해할 수 있다.

basic_concept.ex: It is true that she bought the car yesterday.

in_sentence.how_to: 문장에서: 주어, 목적어, 보어, 전치사의 목적어
in_sentence.ex_s: It is true that she loves him.
I think it true that went there yesterday.

basic_concept.reason_getting_longer:
문장이 길어지는 이유
It is not true that they love their country.
She believes it false that he loves her.

level_1.p: It is ironic that after all the illness and death they have caused, rats are helping to save human lives.
It is the clearest proof that the dog was the animal which first became used to living near the villages.
It is true, however, that rivers have also caused millions of people much misery and unhappiness throughout history.
But it should be realized that floods occur once in several years.
Therefore, it is natural that we guarantee the quality of this clock.

level_2.p: It is true that the U. S. Constitution protects freedom of religion.
It is clear that I must take steps to lose weight.
But it is also true that we have laws in the United States for the protection of all the people.
I find it hard to believe that the Internet is ever going to replace the printed page.
Finally it was discovered that her 7-year-old brother had the same blood type.

level_3.p: On the other hand, it may naturally be demanded that no technical term be used until it has been clearly defined.

practice.p: 다음을 영작하라. That he lives in Inchon is true. → It is true that he lives in Inchon. 2) 다음을 가목적어 진목적어로 바꾸시오. I think that she could read English impossible. → I think it impossible that she could read English. 3) 영작 연습. ① 그들이 그들의 나라를 사랑한다는 것은 사실이 아니다. → It is not true that they love their country. ② 그녀는 그가 그녀를 사랑한다는 것을 거짓이라 믿는다. → She believes it false that she loves him.

item.title: That ~ should 절
item.before_start: That ~ should 절은 미래적 의미가 담겨져 있는 가정법적인 구문이다. 용법 상으로는 요구나 희망사항을 내포하고 있는 문장이다.

basic_concept.ex: 예: It is required that he should go there.

in_sentence.how_to: 문장에서: 주어, 목적어, 보어, 전치사의 목적어
in_sentence.ex_s: It is necessary that she should pass the examination.
It is very important that we should respect our superiors.
They insist that the plan should be carried out.
We porposed that the desks should be changed.

basic_concept.reason_getting_longer:
문장이 길어지는 이유
They recommended that the boss should employ her.
They insisted that the doctor should leave the hospital.

level_1.p: They do not know that they should not drive too fast at night
After several months he decided he should have another raise.
Experts advise that Americans should eat at least 5 to 7 servings of fruit and vegetables daily.
Just as I settle down to read or watch television, my little brother demands that I play with him He told a teller it was urgent that he speak with a manager.

level_2.p: When we decided to have group photographs taken, one of my friends kept on insisting that a group should not consist of three persons.
I honestly say that our library should be a more convenient place than it is now.
Mr. Allen suggested that people should have 'clean-up days' when volunteers get together to clean the beach.
In other words, though lonely people may have many social contacts, they sometimes feel they should have more.
Today more women are taking lifetime jobs, just like men, and I also think that we should take our work more seriously.

level_3.p: Both intellectual integrity and successful practical action require that our opinions in one area should not conflict with our opinions in another.
Some people argue that people should be allowed to exercise complete economic freedom of choice.
I decide where we should live, how we should invest our money, and ⑤where we should go on vacation.

practice.p: 다음을 영작하라. ① It is necessary that she should pass the examination. → 그녀는 그 시험에 통과해야 한다. ② It is very important that we should respect our superiors. → 우리는 연장자를 존중해야한다. ③ They insist that the plan should be carried out. → 그들은 그 계획이 수행되어야 한다고 주장한다. ④ We proposed that the desks should be changed. → 우리는 그 책상이 바뀌어야 한다고 제안했다. 2) 다음을 영작하시오. ① 그들은 그 사장이 그녀를 고용할 것을 추천했다. → They recommended that the boss should employ the girl. ② 그들은 그 의사가 그 병원을 떠나야한다고 주장했다. → They insisted that the doctor should leave the hospital..

item.title: 관계대명사절
item.before_start: 관계대명사 절은 형용사 절이다. 용어 자체가 대명사라는 어휘가 있지만 관계대명사절을 형용사절이라는 사실을 정확히 숙지해야한다. 다시 말하면 관계대명사 절은 명사를 수식한다는 의미이다.

basic_concept.ex: 예: who came here yesterday, which lives in the river, who she introduced to me.

in_sentence.how_to: 문장에서: 한정적 용법, 서술적 용법(계속적 용법)
in_sentence.ex_s: This is the man who came here yesterday.
This is the camera which I bought yesterday.
This is the woman I met last night.
The house which he lives in is very large.

basic_concept.reason_getting_longer:
문장이 길어지는 이유
The dog which I had was very big.
I know the girl whose mother is our teacher.
This is a ship that was built in our country.
The man whom we invited did not come.
What he says is not true.
That is the lady whom I met yesterday.
I met a boy whose parents were dead.

level_1.p: That is exactly the question which I expected you to ask
The last thing I felt was strong hands gripping me, picking me up.
I already began to appreciate the hearty enthusiasm with which Americans always speak of their country
I still remember something that excited me twenty years ago.
His speculations have none of that vagueness which is the common fault of political philosophy.
His work is designed for readers who are already acquainted with the ordinary books on English history
And there are perhaps a few who don't accurately know the difference between impudence and wit."

level_2.p: And, so we propose to devote this little book to unfolding our idea of what this Something Within is, and what it will do for one who will unfold it and thus express it into action.
There is one peculiarity about Mr. Hallam which, while it adds to the value of his writings, will, we fear, take away something from their popularity.
So there is often a portion of willing credulity and enthusiasm in the veneration which the most discerning men pay to their political idols.
I knew that Coney was an island, and that it was a place where people had to be attracted and distracted somehow,
People who know only one language are probably more narrow-minded than those who can speak more than one language.

level_3.p: Those who said that we don't know as much as we thought to know were the prophets, the discoverers.
The young man who talks tenderly to a woman about the weather, while gazing at her face, leaves the way open for retreat.
Byrd found that the other half group was five times as likely to need antibiotics and three times as likely to develop complications as those who were prayed for.
Theory further helps us to recognize that we have new situations which indicate gaps in our knowledge.

But no, he decided after studying the pattern for a while, these were prints carved by a small, wormlike creature that arose in long-vanished archaic organism, that lived about 550 million years ago, just before the geological period known as the Pre-Cambrian.

practice.p: 다음을 영작하라. ①이것이 삼촌이 나에게 준 연필이다. →This is the pencil which my uncle gave me. ②이것은 내가 읽고 싶어했던 책이다. →This is the book which I wanted to read. ③이 사람이 내가 함께 이야기했던 친구이다. →This is the friend whom I talked with. ④저 너머에서 당신이 보는 나무는 매우 크다. →The tree which you see over there is very tall. ⑤그녀는 가족이 한 방에서 살아야 하는 가난한 농부를 보았다. →She saw a poor farmer whose family had to live only in a room. ⑥나는 이 그림을 그린 소녀를 알고 있다. →I know the girl who drew this picture. ⑦그는 우리가 믿을 수 있는 사람이다. →He is the man whom we can trust. ⑧누구든지 게으른 사람은 훌륭한 사람이 못된다. →Whoever is lazy cannot be a good man. ⑨아버지께서 주신 책은 재미있었다. →The book which my father gave me was interesting. ⑩나는 그가 쓴 작문을 읽었다. →I read the composition which he wrote.

item.title: 관계부사절
item.before_start: 관계 부사절은 형용사 절이다. 대부분의 학생이 부사절이 아닐까 생각하지만 관계 부사절은 형용사 절이다. 관계대명사절과 같이 명사를 수식한다는 의미이다.

basic_concept.ex: 예: When they come, where they meet together, how she accomplished it,

in_sentence.ex_s: I don't know the time when he comes.
They don't like the place where they meet together.
Do you know the reason why they said so.
Can you explain the way how he accomplished it.

basic_concept.reason_getting_longer:
문장이 길어지는 이유
① Can you guess the place where they study?
② I don't want to tell you the reason why I am late.
③ She doesn't know the time when he comes back.
④ Will you tell me the way how you finished it?

level_1.p: I know why we have to keep moving,
Doctors are excited about a new way they have found to help broken bones heal.
We look at what these kids are wearing and see how we can design clothes everybody will like.

level_2.p: By the time the children come home from school, he has already finished all the household chores.
Stations were places where slaves could rest during their journey to freedom.
The reason I want to lose weight is that finding appropriate clothing is a nightmare.
It is therefore necessary for them to visit a good library, where they can read a great variety of books on the subject they love.

And if living standards were reduced to a point where dangerous diseases could not be controlled, the point where dangerous diseases could not be controlled, the death rate would rise among the wealthy as well as the poor.

practice.p: 비교 구별 *명사절과 형용사절의 차이 1.다음 문장의 절을 명사절과 형용사절로 나누어 보시오. (1) ⓐ Do you know the way how he overcame the situation? ⓑ Do you know how he overcame the situation? ⓒ This is how he overcame the situation. (2) ⓐ No one knows when he will come or whether he will come at all, or whether he is even alive. ⓑ Fall is when farmers are busiest. ⓒ It was a time when computers were rare. (3) ⓐ That you will be able to meet her before long is certain. ⓑ This is the house that he built. - 96 - ⓒ The fact that she met the man is true. (4) ⓐ Do you know that he bought the house yesterday? ⓑ This is what he bought yesterday. (5) ⓐ Do you know what he did this morning? ⓑ This is what he did this morning. (6) ⓐ I dont know the place where he was born. ⓑ I dont know where he was born. ⓒ This is where he was born. (7) ⓐ I dont know the reason why he is absent. ⓑ I dont know why he is absent. ⓒ That's why he is absent. (8) ⓐ You may choose whichever you like. ⓑ You may choose whichever car you want. (9) ⓐ Do you know which she bought? ⓑ This is the building which she bought. (10) ⓐ I know the boy whose mother helped the poor. ⓑ I dont know whose mother helped the poor. (11) ⓐ I know the man who stole the money. ⓑ Do you know who stole the money? (12) ⓐ Whatever she explains is easy. ⓑ Whatever lesson she explains is easy. (13) ⓐ This is the boy whom he bought the shoes. ⓑ Do you know whom he bought the shoes? (14) Whoever wants to study computer must buy the book. (15) I will employ whomever you want.

item.title: 부사절
item.before_start: 영어 문장에서 부사의 개념은 실로 다양한다. 시간을 의미한느 부사적 개념에서 부터 이유와 원인을 의미하는 부사, 의도나 목적을 표현하는 부사적 개념 등등 다양하다. 중요한 것은 이러한 다양한 개념들을 하나의 부사로 통합할 수 있는 사고적 능력이다.

basic_concept.ex: 예: When he came here, Because she is from America.
basic_concept.in_Korean: 해석 : 해석하는 방법은 부사의 종류에 따라 수십가지로 나뉘어 질 수 있다.

in_sentence.how_to: 문장에서: 때, 장소, 이유 등을 표현하는 부사적 개념이다.
in_sentence.ex_s: I was reading a book when she came back.
She cried as soon as she heard the news.
They had a party where the student was studying.
The child was very happy because he met his mother again.

level_1.p: I was scared that you would never wake up,
Breeze felt so awful that he’d pushed us so hard.
Recent controversies have, however, given so much importance to this subject, that we will offer a few remarks on it.
For myself, although I was on the threshold of the greatest adventure of my life, I was unaware of being excited
When he has given you a chance to talk, this sort of interviewer listens, helps, corrects, advises, but never makes a note.

level_2.p: Even though I’m having to suffer like this, it’s not me I worry about
She cared for me and hugged me when things went wrong, even though she was only two years older than me and had harder work to do.
If such arguments are to pass current, it will be easy to prove that there was never such a thing as religious persecution since the creation.
And I remained of this conviction even when I sat in the captain's own room, smoking his august cigars and turning over his books.

level_3.p: The distinction between energy in matter and energy in the ether will be apparent, on considering that both the ether and energy in some form must be conceived as existing independent of matter; though every atom were annihilated, the ether would remain and all the energy embodied in the atoms would be still in existence in the ether.

So long as the atoms of matter were regarded as hard round particles, they were assumed to be inert and only active when acted upon by what were called forces, which were held to be entities of some sort, independent of matter.

practice.p:
비교 구별
연습 1.다음을 명사절, 형용사절, 부사절로 구분하시오. (1) ⓐDo you know when he will arrive? ⓑ I don't know the day when he will arrive. ⓒ He will start when she arrives. (2)ⓐ He went to the city where she lived. ⓑI started from where she lived. ⓒ I took him where she lived. - 103 - (3)ⓐ I know that you are right. ⓑ This is the picture that he painted. ⓒI'm glad that you have succeeded in it. (4) ⓐHe asked if his son was there. ⓑHe would not have done so if his son had been there. ⓒDo you know whether she likes it (or not)? ⓓ I will give her the doll whether she likes it or not. (5) ⓐWhatever he buys is cheap and good. ⓑWhatever he buys, it is cheap and good.

item.title: 전치사
item.before_start:
전치사는 영어문장에서 항상 나오는 말이다. 전치사를 이해하기 위해서는 3단계로 학습을 해야한다.
1단계는 전치사의 기본적인 뜻을 이해하는 것이고 2단계는 그것이 문장에서 어떻게 쓰이는지, 어떤구조로 쓰이는지를 정확히 이해해야한다. 3단계는 전치사의 여러가지 뜻을 모두 이해해야한다. 그래야만 영어를 제대로 이해할 수 있다.

basic_concept.mean: 뜻 : 명사나 대명사와 결합하여 형용사구나 부사구를 만드는 말
basic_concept.ex: 예: in the room, with her, by the tree,

in_sentence.ex_s: They play in the room
She likes swimming.
My hobby is collecting stamps.
She is sure of passing the examination.

basic_concept.reason_getting_longer: 문장이 길어지는 이유 ① in the box The apples are in the box. The apples in the box are mine. ② to the building The boy goes to the building. The boy to the building is my friend. ③ from the shop The dog from the shop is white. The dog is from the shop. ④ into the room The ball went into the room. The ball into the room is his. ⑤ out of the office She came out of the office. The girl out of the office is my sister. ⑥ through the box The air passes through the box. The air through the box is cold. ⑦ under the desk The water is under the desk. The water under the desk is hot. ⑧ with a ball The boys play with a ball. The boy with a ball is their son. ⑨ with the woman The girl walks with the woman. The girl with the woman is woman.

contents.explanation: *해석 및 보충 설명 동사를 수식하면 부사구, 명사를 수식하면 형용사구 구: 두 개이상의 단어로 이루어진 말 ① in the box 사과들이 상자 안에 있다. ( 부사구 ) 상자 안에 있는 사과들은 나의 것이다. ( 형용사구 ) ② to the box 그 소년은 상자로 간다. ( 부사구 ) to 는 언제나 이동의 뉘앙스 상자로 가는 소년은 나의 친구이다. ( 형용사구 ) ～로 ③ from the box 그 상자로부터 온 개는 하얗다. ( 형용사구 ) 그 개는 상자로부터 왔다. ( 부사구 ) ④ into the room 그 공이 방으로 들어간다. ( 부사구 ) 방으로 들어가는 공은 그의 것이다. ( 형용사구 ) ⑤ out of the office 그녀는 사무실 밖으로 나왔다. ( 부사구 ) 사무실 밖으로 나오는 그 소녀는 나의 여동생이다. ( 형용사구 ) ⑥ through the box 그 공기는 상자를 통과하여 지나간다. ( 부사구 ) 상자를 통과하는 공기는 차갑다. ( 형용사구 ) ⑦ under the desk 그물은 책상 아래 있다. ( 부사구 ) 책상 아래 있는 물은 뜨겁다. ( 형용사구 ) ⑧ with a ball 그 소년들 은 공을 가지고 논다. ( 부사구 ) 공을 가지고 있는 그 소년은 그들의 아들이다. ( 형용사구 ) ⑨ with the man 그 소녀는 그 여자와 함께 걷는다. ( 부사구 ) with 는 기본적으로 함께의 뉘앙스 그 여자와 함께 있는 그 소녀는 아름답다. ( 형용사구 )
